page.title: 05FARMING-TIRLAS GOCH.
page.content: Tirlas Goch Farm is owned by Pilkintons but managed by Mr Lee. The only produce of the farm is milk about 1800 litres on average per day.The milk is kept in a large refridgerated tank.The cows are all machine milked as it would take well over a day to milk them all by hand.The milking parlour will hold about 24 cows at a time.In the middle of the parlour was a pit where the person involved would connect the cows to the milking machine.The number of cows in the herd is about 160.With 120 cows milking and about 40 dried off(which means they have stopped producing milk).The oldest cow in the herd is about 12 years old.When she grows old she will be sold for milk.This year there were about 140 calves born,most of these will be sold for meat after being treated with growth chemicals.
